DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - Determine incidence severity acute graft-vs-host disease ( GVHD ) patient hematologic malignancy undergo donor peripheral blood stem cell transplantation receive sirolimus , tacrolimus , anti-thymocyte globulin , rituximab GVHD prophylaxis . - Assess time engraftment absolute neutrophil count ( > 0.5 x 10^9/L 3 consecutive day ) platelet count ( > 20 x 10^9/L 3 consecutive day ) patient . - Determine safety , define serious adverse event adverse event related immunosuppressive regimen , first 6 month treatment . Secondary - Assess incidence chronic GVHD measure within 2 year transplantation . - Assess overall disease-free survival 2 year transplantation . - Examine incidence opportunistic infection include fungal infection , pneumocystis carinii pneumonia , viral infection ( cytomegalovirus , varicella zoster virus , herpes simplex virus , BK virus , Epstein-Barr virus , post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder ) . - Assess incidence thrombotic microangiopathy within 100 day transplantation . - Perform immunocorrelative study , include T-cell , B-cell , NK-cell , regulatory cell , allo-reactive T-cell measurement study via flow cytometry , 30 , 60 , 90 , 180 day transplantation . OUTLINE : Patients receive rituximab IV day -7 3 , tacrolimus IV continuously ( may switch orally patient able eat ) oral sirolimus begin day -3 , anti-thymocyte globulin IV 6 hour day -3 -1 . Tacrolimus sirolimus taper discretion treat physician . All patient also receive standard transplant-preparative regimen undergo transplantation day 0 . Blood sample collect preparative regimen 30 , 60 , 90 , 180 day transplantation correlative immunologic study . After completion study treatment , patient follow 2 year .
